Comments_List: I learned how to communicate scientifically and clearly. I learned to be more confident in my understanding of biology and science in general. This class taught me to be more skeptical of different scientific methods and experiments.
I learned so many practical things necessary for working in a biology lab. How to run a gel and it was SO cool to be able to watch an egg get fertilized in real time!

Weaknesses: lack of respect for our time; the lab was not so long that we had to be there until 5 every week when the lab was scheduled for 3 hours. The lab protocol was simple and I just felt like so much time was devoted to unnecessary things (taking pictures, looking at pictures, etc).

I disliked the lack of direction given for how to break down and interpret papers; he assumed we knew how to do so ahead of time when this was the first lab for the majority of people. I appreciated the document on how to construct a job talk, but no insight was given on how to analyze papers.

I get that his lab during the school year is coveted, but I dont need to hear about it during every lab session.

Strengths: lab, experiments, classmates, Professor Woleskni 
Weakness: sometimes lab goes over but taking a 5-10 minute break in the middle is helpful
Yes! Take a tab course to get more acquainted with biological/ scientific research.
100% manageable work load. Wolenski is THE best. He is very accommodating and a very good person
